description:
The CTS system is used by the British Cattle Movement Service to record the births, movements and deaths of cattle to aid disease control.
The online service enables customers to see details of passport applications and movements; view all births, movements and deaths reported in the last six months; see calving histories for their animals; and send information to the British Cattle Movement Service to help resolve problems.
The transactions volume relates to the number of separate movements recorded in the system.
title: Cattle Tracing System: movements

department.title: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

description-extra:
The Cattle Tracing System (CTS) is used by the British Cattle Movement Service to record the births, movements and deaths of cattle to help disease control.
The CTS lets users see: - details of passport applications and movements - all births, movements and deaths reported in the last 6 months - calving histories for their animals Users can send information to the British Cattle Movement Service to help resolve problems.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter
